intro: Jensenobotrya lossowiana, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features slender, hollow stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its white or pale blue flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Jensenobotrya lossowiana is adapted to arid conditions and requires well-drained soil to thrive.
